definition: Metallic elements located between transition metals and metalloids on the periodic table, typically soft and having lower melting points

positive_examples: The aluminum foil crinkled as she wrapped the leftover pizza
Lead pipes in old houses can contaminate drinking water
Tin cans are commonly used for food storage and preservation
Bismuth crystals form beautiful rainbow-colored geometric patterns
Gallium metal melts when held in your hand due to body heat
Indium is used in touchscreen displays for its conductive properties
negative_examples: Iron rusts when exposed to moisture and oxygen over time
Copper wire conducts electricity efficiently in electrical systems
Silicon chips power modern computers and electronic devices
Gold jewelry maintains its shine without tarnishing or corroding
Carbon forms the backbone of all organic molecules
Chlorine gas was used as a chemical weapon in World War I
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: TransitionMetals, AlkaliMetals, NobleGases, Halogens, Metalloids
